org.opengrok.indexer.web

Class SearchHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opengrok.indexer.web.SearchHelper

  • public class SearchHelper
extends Object
    Working set for a search basically to factor out/separate search related complexity from UI design.
    Version:
    $Revision$
    Author:
    Jens Elkner

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SPELLCHECK_SUGGEST_WORD_COUNT

        public int SPELLCHECK_SUGGEST_WORD_COUNT
        max number of words to suggest for spellcheck

      • dataRoot

        public File dataRoot
        opengrok's data root: used to find the search index file

      • contextPath

        public String contextPath
        context path, i.e. the applications context path (usually /source) to use when generating a redirect URL

      • compressed

        public boolean compressed
        piggyback: if true, files in opengrok's data directory are gzipped compressed.

      • sourceRoot

        public File sourceRoot
        piggyback: the source root directory.

      • desc

        public EftarFileReader desc
        piggyback: the eftar filereader to use.

      • start

        public int start
        the result cursor start index, i.e. where to start displaying results

      • maxItems

        public int maxItems
        max. number of result items to show

      • builder

        public QueryBuilder builder
        the QueryBuilder used to create the query

      • order

        public SortOrder order
        the order used for ordering query results

      • parallel

        public boolean parallel
        if true multi-threaded search will be used.

      • isCrossRefSearch

        public boolean isCrossRefSearch
        Indicate, whether this is search from a cross reference. If true executeQuery() sets redirect if certain conditions are met.

      • redirect

        public String redirect
        if not null, the consumer should redirect the client to a separate result page denoted by the value of this field. Automatically set via prepareExec(SortedSet) and executeQuery().

      • errorMsg

        public String errorMsg
        if not null, the UI should show this error message and stop processing the search. Automatically set via prepareExec(SortedSet) and executeQuery().

      • searcher

        public org.apache.lucene.search.IndexSearcher searcher
        the searcher used to open/search the index. Automatically set via prepareExec(SortedSet).

      • hits

        public org.apache.lucene.search.ScoreDoc[] hits
        list of docs which result from the executing the query

      • totalHits

        public long totalHits
        total number of hits

      • query

        public org.apache.lucene.search.Query query
        the query created by builder via prepareExec(SortedSet).

      • sort

        protected org.apache.lucene.search.Sort sort
        the Lucene sort instruction based on order created via prepareExec(SortedSet).

      • checker

        protected org.apache.lucene.search.spell.DirectSpellChecker checker
        the spellchecker object

      • projects

        public SortedSet<String> projects
        projects to use to setup indexer searchers. Usually setup via prepareExec(SortedSet).

      • sourceContext

        public Context sourceContext
        opengrok summary context. Usually created via prepareSummary().

      • summarizer

        public Summarizer summarizer
        result summarizer usually created via prepareSummary().

      • historyContext

        public HistoryContext historyContext
        history context usually created via prepareSummary().

    • Method Detail

      • getFileTypeDescriptions

        public static Set<Map.Entry<String,String>> getFileTypeDescriptions()
        User readable description for file types. Only those listed in fileTypeDescription will be shown to the user. Returns a set of file type descriptions to be used for a search form.
        Returns:
        Set of tuples with file type and description.

      • prepareExec

        public SearchHelper prepareExec(SortedSet<String> projects)
        Create the searcher to use w.r.t. currently set parameters and the given projects. Does not produce any redirect link. It also does nothing if redirect or errorMsg have a none-null value.

        Parameters which should be populated/set at this time:

        • builder
        • dataRoot
        • order (falls back to relevance if unset)
        • parallel (default: false)
        Populates/sets:
        • query
        • searcher
        • sort
        • projects
        • errorMsg if an error occurs
        Parameters:
        projects - project names. If empty, a no-project setup is assumed (i.e. DATA_ROOT/index will be used instead of possible multiple DATA_ROOT/$project/index). If the set contains projects not known in the configuration or projects not yet indexed, an error will be returned in errorMsg.
        Returns:
        this instance

      • prepareExec

        public SearchHelper prepareExec(Project project)
        Calls prepareExec(java.util.SortedSet) with a single-element set for project.
        Parameters:
        project - a defined instance
        Returns:
        this instance

      • executeQuery

        public SearchHelper executeQuery()
        Start the search prepared by prepareExec(SortedSet). It does nothing if redirect or errorMsg have a none-null value.

        Parameters which should be populated/set at this time:

        • all fields required for and populated by prepareExec(SortedSet))
        • start (default: 0)
        • maxItems (default: 0)
        • isCrossRefSearch (default: false)
        Populates/sets:
        • hits (see TopDocs.scoreDocs)
        • totalHits (see TopDocs.totalHits)
        • contextPath
        • errorMsg if an error occurs
        • redirect if certain conditions are met
        Returns:
        this instance

      • getSuggestions

        public List<Suggestion> getSuggestions()
        If a search did not return a hit, one may use this method to obtain suggestions for a new search.

        Parameters which should be populated/set at this time:

        • projects
        • dataRoot
        • builder
        Returns:
        a possible empty list of suggestions.

      • prepareSummary

        public SearchHelper prepareSummary()
        Prepare the fields to support printing a full blown summary. Does nothing if redirect or errorMsg have a none-null value.

        Parameters which should be populated/set at this time:

        • query
        • builder
        Populates/sets: Otherwise the following fields are set (includes null):
        • sourceContext
        • summarizer
        • historyContext
        Returns:
        this instance.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Free any resources associated with this helper (that includes closing the used searcher in case of no-project setup).

      • searchSingle

        public int searchSingle(File file)
                 throws IOException,
                        org.apache.lucene.queryparser.classic.ParseException
        Searches for a document for a single file from the index.
        Parameters:
        file - the file whose definitions to find
        Returns:
        ScoreDoc.doc or -1 if it could not be found
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error happens when accessing the index
        org.apache.lucene.queryparser.classic.ParseException - if an error happens when building the Lucene query

      • getTabSize

        public int getTabSize(Project proj)
               throws IOException
        Gets the persisted tabSize via getSettings(java.lang.String) if available or returns the proj tabSize if available -- or zero.
        Parameters:
        proj - a defined instance or null if no project is active
        Returns:
        tabSize
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs querying the active reader

      • getSettings

        public IndexAnalysisSettings getSettings(String projectName)
                                  throws IOException
        Gets the settings for a specified project, querying the active reader upon the first call after prepareExec(java.util.SortedSet).
        Parameters:
        projectName - a defined instance or null if no project is active (or empty string to mean the same thing)
        Returns:
        a defined instance or null if none is found
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs querying the active reader
